comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Photo dated 1912. See en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marie-Ad%c3%a9la%c3%afde,_Grand_Duc... The portrait there could be of the young woman with the sash. "when her father died on 25 February 1912, she became the first reigning Grand Duchess of Luxembourg."

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The older woman above might possibly be one of two previous grand duchesses who had the title as consort of a grand duke. They were en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adelheid-Marie_of_Anhalt-Dessau and en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marie_Anne_of_Portugal The latter was Marie Adelaide's mother.

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks swanq.  We could definitely do a better job identifying Marie Adelaide.  We'll also add the photographer and date next time we update this record.

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Maria-Adelheid, Grand Duchess of Luxembourg (Luxembourgish: Maria Adelheid Theresia Hilda Antonia Wilhelmina vu Lëtzebuerg; French: Marie Adélaïde Thérèse Hilda Antonie Wilhelmine; Berg Castle, 14 June 1894 – Schloss Hohenburg, 24 January 1924) was a daughter of Grand Duke William IV of Luxembourg and Marie Anne of Portugal. Her maternal grandparents were Miguel of Portugal and Adelaide of Löwenstein-Wertheim-Rosenberg.

comment.author: 87974483@N02
comment._content: They are leaving the Chamber of Deputies in Luxembourg City, which is next to the Grand Ducal Palace. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chamber_of_Deputies_(Luxembourg)

comment.author: 63860770@N07
comment._content: Thanks for identifying the location demeeschter. We'll add it to the catalog record.
